projects.name: aardvark
projects.description:
A project for the nocturnal. Only night time issues may be created and or worked on.

This project uses Apache Ant for building; Apache Pig for analysis.

projects.name: Abdera
projects.description: The Abdera project is an implementation of the Atom Syndication Format (RFC4287) and the Atom Publishing Protocol specifications published by the IETF Atompub working group.

projects.name: Accumulo
projects.description: Accumulo is a sorted, distributed key/value store based on Google's BigTable design. It is built on top of Apache Hadoop, Zookeeper, and Thrift. It features a few novel improvements on the BigTable design in the form of cell-level access labels and a server-side programming mechanism that can modify key/value pairs at various points in the data management process.

projects.name: ACE
projects.description: Apache ACE is a software distribution framework that allows you to centrally manage and distribute software components, configuration data and other artifacts to target systems. It is built using OSGi and can be deployed in different topologies. The target systems are usually also OSGi based, but don't have to be.

projects.name: ActiveCluster
projects.description: ActiveCluster is an API for writing cluster-based distributed systems

projects.name: ActiveMQ
projects.description: Apache ActiveMQ is the most popular and powerful open source Message Broker. Apache ActiveMQ is fast, supports many Cross Language Clients and Protocols and many advanced features while fully supporting JMS 1.1 and J2EE 1.4. Apache ActiveMQ is released under the Apache 2.0 License

projects.name: ActiveMQ .Net
projects.description: The .Net and C# project of Apache ActiveMQ

projects.name: ActiveMQ C++ Client
projects.description: Provides a native C++ API for clients to access ActiveMQ

projects.name: ActiveRealTime
projects.description: Messaging framework to meet the needs of low latency high throughput collaborative real-time applications.

projects.name: Addressing
projects.description: WS-Addressing Implementation

projects.name: Airavata
projects.description: Airavata is a software toolkit for executing and managing computational jobs on distributed computing resources including local clusters, supercomputers, national grids, academic and commercial clouds. Users can use Airavata back end services and build web interfaces to deploy in open social containers such as Apache Rave and modify them to suit their needs. Airavata builds on general concepts of service oriented computing, distributed messaging, and workflow composition and orchestration.

projects.name: ALOIS
projects.description: ALOIS is a log collection and correlation software with reporting and alarming functionalities

projects.name: AltRMI
projects.description: Alternative to RMI.

projects.name: AMATERASU
projects.description: Apache Amaterasu is a framework providing continuous deployment for Big Data pipelines.

projects.name: Ambari
projects.description: Ambari is a monitoring, administration and lifecycle management project for Apache Hadoop clusters.

projects.name: Amber
projects.description:
Amber is a Java development framework mainly aimed to build OAuth-aware applications.

** This project is retired **

projects.name: Anakia
projects.description: Anakia uses Apache Velocity to generate documents based on XML source files.

projects.name: Apache AGE
projects.description: AGE is a multi-model database that enables graph and relational models built on PostgreSQL.This project is a new generation of a multi-model graph database for the modern complex data environment.

projects.name: Apache Any23
projects.description: Anything To Triples (any23) is a library, a web service and a command line tool that extracts structured data in RDF format from a variety of Web documents.

projects.name: Apache AsterixDB
projects.description: The AsterixDB semi-structured parallel data management platform.

projects.name: Apache Avro
projects.description: Avro is a serialization system.

projects.name: Apache BlueMarlin
projects.description: BlueMarlin will develop a web service to add intelligence functionality to a plain ad system.

projects.name: Apache Chainsaw
projects.description: Chainsaw is an Apache Logging Services companion GUI to Log4j for receiving, parsing, viewing, and filtering logs.

projects.name: Apache Climate Model Diagnostic Analyzer
projects.description:
This project has retired.

The Climate Model Diagnostic Analyzer (CMDA) provides web services for multi-aspect physics-based and phenomenon-oriented climate model performance evaluation and diagnosis through the comprehensive and synergistic use of multiple observational data, reanalysis data, and model outputs.

projects.name: Apache Commons Geometry
projects.description: Shapes, coordinates, ...

projects.name: Apache Commons RDF
projects.description: Commons RDF aims to provide a common library for RDF 1.1 that could be implemented by systems on the Java Virtual Machine.

projects.name: Apache Commons Statistics
projects.description: Apache Commons Statistics

projects.name: Apache Commons Testing
projects.description: Resuable code libraries to facilitate writing test code.

projects.name: Apache Concerted
projects.description:
** This project is retired **

Apache Concerted is a Do-It-Yourself toolkit for building in-memory data engines.

projects.name: Apache Coral
projects.description: Coral is a data processing system to flexibly control the runtime behaviors of a job to adapt to varying deployment characteristics.

projects.name: Apache Cordova
projects.description: Apache Cordova is a platform for building native mobile applications using HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

projects.name: Apache Crail
projects.description: Crail is a storage platform for sharing performance critical data in distributed data processing jobs at very high speed

projects.name: Apache Curator
projects.description:
Welcome to Curator

Curator is a set of Java libraries that make using Apache ZooKeeper much easier. While ZooKeeper comes bundled with a Java client, using the client is non-trivial and error prone.

projects.name: Apache DataLab
projects.description: DataLab is a platform for creating self-service, exploratory data science environments in the cloud using best-of-breed data science tools.

projects.name: Apache Datasketches
projects.description: Apache Datasketches

projects.name: Apache DirectMemory
projects.description: DirectMemory's main purpose is to to act as a second level cache able to store large amounts of data without filling up the Java heap and thus avoiding long garbage collection cycles.

projects.name: Apache Drill
projects.description: Drill is a distributed system for interactive analysis of large-scale datasets, inspired by Google's Dremel.

projects.name: Apache Dubbo
projects.description: Dubbo is a high-performance, lightweight, java based RPC framework.

projects.name: Apache ECharts
projects.description: ECharts is a charting and data visualization library written in JavaScript.

projects.name: Apache EventMesh
projects.description: EventMesh is a dynamic cloud-native eventing infrastruture used to decouple the application and backend middleware layer, which supports a wide range of use cases that encompass complex multi-cloud, widely distributed topologies using diverse technology stacks.

projects.name: Apache Fineract
projects.description: Apache Fineract (\’fīn-,ǝ-ˌrakt\) is an open source system for core banking as a platform. Fineract provides a reliable, robust, and affordable solution for entrepreneurs, financial institutions, and service providers to offer financial services to the world’s 2 billion underbanked and unbanked.

projects.name: Apache Freemarker
projects.description: This is the new issue tracker for this project, since 2015 October. See earlier issues at: https://sourceforge.net/p/freemarker/bugs/ and https://sourceforge.net/p/freemarker/feature-requests/!

projects.name: Apache Gearpump
projects.description: * - This project is retired - * Apache Gearpump is a lightweight real-time streaming engine built on top of Akka.

projects.name: Apache Gora
projects.description: The Apache Gora™ open source framework provides an in-memory data model and persistence for big data. Gora supports persisting to column stores, key value stores, document stores, distributed in-memory key/value stores, in-memory data grids, in-memory caches, distributed multi-model stores, and hybrid in-memory architectures. Gora also enables analysis of data with extensive Apache Hadoop MapReduce and Apache Spark support.

projects.name: Apache Helix
projects.description: Apache Helix is a generic cluster management framework used for the automatic management of partitioned, replicated and distributed resources hosted on a cluster of nodes. Helix automates reassignment of resources in the face of node failure and recovery, cluster expansion, and reconfiguration.

projects.name: Apache Hop (incubating)
projects.description: Hop is short for the Hop Orchestration Platform. Written completely in Java it aims to provide a wide range of data orchestration tools, including a visual development environment, servers, metadata analysis, auditing services and so on.  As a platform, Hop also wants to be a reusable library so that it can be easily reused by other software.

projects.name: Apache Horn
projects.description: The Apache Horn is an Apache Incubating project, a neuron-centric programming model and Sync and Async hybrid distributed training framework, supports both data and model parallelism for training large models with massive datasets. Unlike most systems having matrix approach to neural network training, Horn adopted the the neuron-centric model which enables training large-scale deep learning on highly scalable CPU cluster. In the future, we plan also to support GPU accelerations for heterogeneous devices.

projects.name: Apache Hudi
projects.description: Hudi provides atomic upserts and incremental data streams on big data.

projects.name: Apache InLong
projects.description: Apache InLong is a one-stop data streaming platform that provides automatic, secure, distributed, and efficient data publishing and subscription capabilities. This platform helps you easily build stream-based data applications.

projects.name: Apache IoTDB
projects.description: IoTDB is a data store for managing large amounts of time series data such as timestamped data from IoT sensors in industrial applications.

projects.name: Apache Jena
projects.description: Apache Jena

projects.name: Apache Knox
projects.description:
Welcome to your project

Everything you need to know about how your project is running is tracked on this page. As your project evolves, the information will be updated. Use the tabs on the left to navigate within your project.

Describe your project here

Change the project description to include details about your project.

projects.name: Apache Lens (Retired)
projects.description: This project has been retired. Please refer to https://attic.apache.org/projects/lens.html for further details.

projects.name: Apache Liminal
projects.description: Apache Liminal is an end-to-end platform for data engineers & scientists, allowing them to build, train and deploy machine learning models in a robust and agile way. The platform provides the abstractions and declarative capabilities for data extraction & feature engineering followed by model training and serving. Apache Liminal's goal is to operationalise the machine learning process, allowing data scientists to quickly transition from a successful experiment to an automated pipeline of model training, validation, deployment and inference in production, freeing them from engineering and non-functional tasks, and allowing them to focus on machine learning code and artifacts.

projects.name: Apache Linkis
projects.description: Apache Linkis builds a computation middleware layer to decouple the upper applications and the underlying data engines, provides standardized interfaces (REST, JDBC, WebSocket etc.) to easily connect to various underlying engines (Spark, Presto, Flink, etc.), while enables cross engine context sharing, unified job& engine governance and orchestration.

projects.name: Apache MADlib
projects.description: MADlib is an open source library for scalable in-database analytics. It provides data-parallel implementations of mathematical, statistical, graph and machine learning methods for structured and unstructured data. It uses shared-nothing, distributed, scale-out architectures to offer data scientists an effective toolset for challenging problems involving very large data sets. MADlib is SQL-based and supports Greenplum Database and PostgreSQL.

projects.name: Apache Maven Resource Bundles
projects.description:
This project a set of resources to help you building Java resources compliant with Apache rules.

Note: This is not the place to report issues about Maven in general. See this page to find the correct issue tracker.

projects.name: Apache MetaModel (Retired)
projects.description:
This project has been retired. Please refer to https://attic.apache.org/projects/apache metamodel.html for further details.


A data access framework, providing a common interface for discovery, exploration of metadata and querying of different types of data sources.

All current Jira cases have been moved to the Apache NiFi Jira project (NIFI) with a Component type of "MiNiFi". New Jira issues should be created under the NIFI project with a Component of MiNiFi.

The Apache Open Climate Workbench proposal desires to contribute an existing community of software related to the analysis and evaluation of climate models, and related to the use of remote sensing data in that process.

projects.name: Apache Pegasus
projects.description: A distributed key-value storage system which is designed to be simple, horizontally scalable, strongly consistent and high-performance.

projects.name: Apache Petri
projects.description: The Apache Petri (as in "petri dish" ���where cultures are grown and bloom) committee assists external project communities interested in becoming an Apache project to learn how The Apache Software Foundation (ASF) works, its views on community, and how to build a healthy community for the long term.

projects.name: Apache Pinot
projects.description: Pinot is a real-time distributed OLAP datastore. It can ingest data from offline data sources (such as Hadoop and flat files) as well as online sources (such as Kafka).

projects.description:
Creadur is comprehension and auditing for distributions and source code.

Project Creadur will provide a focus for components, applications and integration tools for the comprehension and audit of distributions and source code. It will collect data and meta-data as required. It will create suitable schemas for this data and meta-data as required.

projects.name: Apache Ripple
projects.description: Apache Ripple is a web based mobile environment simulator designed to enable rapid development of mobile web applications for various web application frameworks, such as Apache Cordova and BlackBerry WebWorks.

projects.name: Apache RocketMQ
projects.description: Apache RocketMQ is a distributed messaging and streaming platform with low latency, high performance and reliability, trillion-level capacity and flexible scalability.

projects.name: Apache Roller

projects.description: S4 (Simple Scalable Streaming System) is a general-purpose, distributed, scalable, robust, pluggable platform that allows programmers to easily develop applications for processing continuous, unbounded streams of data.

projects.name: Apache Twill (Retired)
projects.description:
This project has been retired. Please refer to https://attic.apache.org/projects/twill.html for further details.


Apache Twill is an abstraction over Apache Hadoop® YARN that reduces the complexity of developing distributed applications, allowing developers to focus instead on their application logic. Apache Twill allows you to use YARN’s distributed capabilities with a programming model that is similar to running threads.

projects.name: Apache Wayang
projects.description: Wayang is a cross-platform data processing system that aims at decoupling the business logic of data analytics applications from concrete data processing platforms, such as Apache Flink or Apache Spark. Hence, it tames the complexity that arises from the ���Cambrian explosion��� of novel data processing platforms that we currently witness.

projects.name: Buildr
projects.description: Buildr is a build system for Java applications written in Ruby. We wanted something that's simple and intuitive to use, so we only need to tell it what to do, and it takes care of the rest. But also something we can easily extend for those one-off tasks, with a language that's a joy to use. And of course, we wanted it to be fast, reliable and have outstanding dependency management.
